body: ### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues ### Current behaviour Currently, all block mined time in testnet could be about 1 hour earlier than current time. link: https://blockexplorer.one/bitcoin/testnet Timestamp in UpdateTip is wrong. ``` â app-generic 2024-05-16T06:57:48Z Saw new header hash=000000000000000ba2e0919b2ab27d045c41bd4e6115667c2ef453e405db01da height=2815696 â â app-generic 2024-05-16T06:57:48Z [net] Saw new cmpctblock header hash=000000000000000ba2e0919b2ab27d045c41bd4e6115667c2ef453e405db01da peer=11 â â app-generic 2024-05-16T06:57:48Z UpdateTip: new best=000000000000000ba2e0919b2ab27d045c41bd4e6115667c2ef453e405db01da height=2815696 version=0x2 â â 235c000 log2_work=75.782354 tx=135221647 date='2024-05-16T07:51:39Z' progress=1.000000 cache=209.9MiB(1241814txo) ``` Looks like wrong stamp is derived from getblocktemplate response? 'curtime' and 'mintime' is always quite earlier than current time. ### Expected behaviour Block mined time should be close to current time. ### Steps to reproduce Execute `bitcoin-cli getblocktemplate '{"rules": ["segwit"]}'`, check 'curtime' and 'mintime'. ### Relevant log output _No response_ ### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core Package manager ### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using? v25.0 ### Operating system and version Ubuntu18 ### Machine specifications _No response_
title: Wrong block mined time in testnet
